reviews.text: This hotel is wonderful. You are made to feel welcome from the minute you enter the incredibly large door to reception. We had a standard room (105) with a balcony which was a good size and wonderfully decorated abd furnished. You could stand in the shower and look out towards Marrakech.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast has everything you could wish for including around 7 different fruit juices, all freshly squeezed. The pool area was well layed out and had great views of the mountains.
reviews.title: Gorgeous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The spa was very good. I have the Hamman with scrub and a facial which I would highly recommend.
reviews.title: A secluded retreat

reviews.text: We enjoyed the free shuttle service to Marrakech - make sure you book and you'll be fine. It's only about a 15 minute drive and they were always on time. The staff are lovely and always on hand to help out.
reviews.title: More than we expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in one of the suites with a private garden leading onto the swimming pools. Our room was spacious and tastefully decorated, and we enjoyed the "towel art" and flower petals which were scattered on the bed and bathroom. The private garden, complete with sun loungers, was lovely - a sun trap and a nice retreat when the pool was busy.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Sirayane
reviews.title: Ultra Cool - caring owner

reviews.text: If you have been staying in the Medina of Marrakech as we had the ultra cool modernity of this hotel along with its remote and bleak position is a bit of a culture shock after the highly decorative environment of the city. If you come here straight from the plane you won’t be affected in this way and will start to relax straight away.
reviews.title: Excellent small hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a suite with a private pool. The suite was spacious, comfortable with two larges TV’s and dvd players. The bathroom was light and airy with a Jacuzzi bath and a separate shower which was super. The bed was comfortable and there was a kettle for making tea and coffee. We got milk from the bar and kept it in the fridge.They couldn’t believe we wanted milk in our tea!!!! Take you own teabags unless you want to drink only mint tea.
reviews.title: Stylish, wonderfull staff, soo comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a huge garden with an excellent pool, it was a really good size and it was deliciously warm. There was a cover to put on every night to keep the heat in – the nights were very cold at the beginning of February. In this hotel they have the most comfortable double sunbeds and there was one in our garden along with other furniture. This suite was definitely worth the cost and once we were there we didn’t really leave it having had several days in Marrakech already we gave any sights we hadn’t seem a miss and enjoyed our pool as we were only there for 2 days.
reviews.title: Superb oasis away from the hubbub

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotels main pool area is rather clever; it is sunken so you are out of any wind. There are two pools, one is heated and that is where everyone swam while we were there. The other pool is very large and as there are only about 28 rooms there would be space for everyone at busy times in summer. Around it are the very comfortable double sunbeds and an excellent pool attendant to hand out and arrange the huge towels for you.
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a week at the Sirayane after deciding we wanted to go somewhere with sunshine and a chilled out atmosphere. The Sirayane proved to be an excellent choice. It was raining when we arrived, but for the rest of the week it was mainly sunny, although cloudy at times. We made use of the pick up service to get to and from the airport, which was good value at about £15 each way.
reviews.title: Relaxing stay in beautiful surroundings

reviews.text: THE ROOM
reviews.title: Friendly hotel with excellent spa

reviews.text: We had a garden room which was spacious with a lovely walk in shower and a large flat screen TV. The bed was a bit too hard for our tastes and we both ended up with backache by the end of the week, but then we had spent a long time lazing around on the double sunbeds.We didn't really use the garden because we were only steps away from the pool area. Curiously though there was no coffee available in the room, only tea. The mini bar wasn't regularly replenished and the bottled water in the room when we arrived wasn't replenished.
reviews.title: Eleven out of Ten, Sirayane !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: POOL AREA
reviews.title: Great place to enjoy the winter sun
Excellent hotel away from the hustle and bustle
reviews.text: Neither of us used the pool itself, but the area around was spotless and there was always a member of staff on standby to help move your umbrella if you wanted shade. There were large pillows as well and free towels as well, and you could order drinks. It was wonderfully quiet and relaxing, with a view of the snow covered Atlas mountains.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the Sirayane as in other reviews is an excellent place to stay. the staff are friendly and helpful. the owner and manager regularly walk around to ask how everyting is.
reviews.title: peaceful away from the souks

reviews.text: The hotel is outside the city. this is perfect if you are wanting to combine visiting Marrakech with a chance to relax. The hotel is a modern design, minimalist in comparison to the normal Morroccan styling. The pool area has comfortable beds and is quiet (no loud music during our stay). we had a suite with private pool which enhance the getaway feeling.
reviews.title: Fabulous Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a free shuttle bus into the city, which was always on time. Booking is needed.
reviews.title: Relaxing small luxury hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel food was very good. The evening menu was not anymore expensive than a good quality restaurant in the city. The menu did not change. The lunch menu was more restricted and a little more expensive for essentially a sandwich with chips.
reviews.title: sirayane marrakesh, a peaceful oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: worth taking a trip into the Atlas mountains. The hotel can arrange this. If you can share this with 2 others (4 in total) is the cost good value.
reviews.title: Spectacular
